item.title: Getting started with garbage-collection
item.description: Introduction # Objects become eligible for garbage collection (GC) if they are no longer reachable by the main entry point(s) in a program. GC is usually not performed explicitly by the user, but to let the GC know an object is no longer needed a developer can: Dereference / assign null someFunction { var a = 1; var b = 2; a = null; // GC can now free the memory used for variable a .
